CONTROLS AND INDICATORS Embraer Legacy 450/500 and Praetor 500/600 Multifunction Keyboard Panel Pro Line Fusion® Avionics

Alphanumeric Key- pad

The alphanumeric keypad includes keys for each letter of the alphabet and each numerical digit, in addition to a Space (SP), a slash (/), a decimal point (.), a plus/minus toggle (+/−), and an ENTER button.

CNCL Cancel Button

The CNCL button is used to cancel an in-process ﬂight plan edit.

FMS FMS Quick Access Key

The FMS QAK displays a FMS format on the on-side MFW of the bottom display unit (DU4). The on-side cursor is positioned on the FMS format. Multiple pushes of the FMS QAK cycles through the FMS formats.

ROUTE Route Quick Ac- cess Key

Selecting the ROUTE QAK shows the ROUTE window format on the MFW.

MSG Message Quick Access Key

Pushing the MSG QAK shows or removes the FMS MESSAGES dialog box on the MFW.

DEP/ARR Departures/Arrivals Quick Access Key

While airborne, selecting the DEP/ARR QAK shows the ARRIVALS dialog box on a multifunction window. When on the ground, selecting the DEP/ARR button shows the DEPARTURES dialog box on a multifunction window.

Ɖ→ Direct-To Quick Access Key

Pushing the (Ɖ→) QAK brings up a Direct-To dialog box which is used to edit the ﬂight plan.

5th Edition 4-18 02 APR 19

Embraer Legacy 450/500 and Praetor 500/600 CONTROLS AND INDICATORS Pro Line Fusion® Avionics Multifunction Keyboard Panel

EXEC Execute Button

Pushing the EXEC button executes a Modiﬁed (MOD) ﬂight plan making it the Active (ACT) ﬂight plan. The light bar above the EXEC button illuminates when there is a modiﬁed ﬂight plan.

MEM Memorized Formats Button

The MEM button provides the ability to memorize the formats selected for each display in the ﬂight deck. Three conﬁgurations are set by the OEM and six conﬁgurations are user deﬁned. Each is recalled by selecting the MEM button followed by a numeric key (1-9). Flight deck display conﬁgurations are memorized by pushing and holding the MEM button for 3 seconds, followed by selection of the desired numeric key. The conﬁgurations can be memorized and recalled from either MKP. When the MEM button is selected, the MEM RECALL information box displays on the on-side PFD.

CLR/DEL Clear/Delete Button

The CLR/DEL button performs two functions, depending on whether there is data in the scratchpad.

When there is data in the scratchpad, pushing and immediately releasing the CLR/DEL button backspaces one character at a time, or pushing and momentarily holding the CLR/DEL button clears the entire scratchpad.

5th Edition 02 APR 19 4-19
